data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle
data.output: Marc was, as his friends would describe him, a 'petrol head': he loved cars, motorbikes, trucks, pretty much anything that looked good and could hit high speeds. When Marc graduated university, he moved to a small town and adopted a dog, named Diesel, to keep him company. Marc and Diesel would drive around the town in Marc's Ford Mustang, listening to rock music, with the windows down. Let's pump up the volume! Marc shouted to Diesel as they drove away into the sunset.
data.original_output: Marc was, as his friends would describe him, a 'petrol head': he loved cars, motorbikes, trucks, pretty much anything that looked good and could hit high speeds. When Marc graduated university, he moved to a small town and adopted a dog, named Diesel, to keep him company. Marc and Diesel would drive around the town in Marc's Ford Mustang, listening to rock music, with the windows down. Let's pump up the volume! Marc shouted to Diesel as they drove away into the sunset.

data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it
data.output: Emma wanted to send a message to the public about climate change. She felt that people were not taking the subject seriously, and she wanted to do something about it, drawing as much attention as possible to the issue. Emma visited her local craft store, where she bought giant stamps for every letter of the alphabet, and colourful inks to suit. On her walk home, Emma stamped important and significant messages on the sides of buildings, in the middle of the streets, on public benches and bins, to spread the word about climate change.
data.original_output: Emma wanted to send a message to the public about climate change. She felt that people were not taking the subject seriously, and she wanted to do something about it, drawing as much attention as possible to the issue. Emma visited her local craft store, where she bought giant stamps for every letter of the alphabet, and colourful inks to suit. On her walk home, Emma stamped important and significant messages on the sides of buildings, in the middle of the streets, on public benches and bins, to spread the word about climate change.

data.boring_theme: having an organ empire and complying with regulations
data.output: Sean regularly visited his local music shop, as he loved to play the organ. He dreamed of owning his own one day, but he could not afford such a grand purchase, and did not have space in his apartment on the east side of town. He also chose not to comply with store rules, that musical instruments were not to be played, only to be purchased. Sean was frustrated with the music and retail empire, he wished for a day where music shops were open to all where people could gather and showcase their talents.
data.original_output: Sean regularly visited his local music shop, as he loved to play the organ. He dreamed of owning his own one day, but he could not afford such a grand purchase, and did not have space in his apartment on the east side of town. He also chose not to comply with store rules, that musical instruments were not to be played, only to be purchased. Sean was frustrated with the music and retail empire, he wished for a day where music shops were open to all where people could gather and showcase their talents.

data.boring_theme: the feeling of gloom you have about an existing payment
data.output: The current political climate left Rachel feeling a sense of gloom. She wondered what she had done to exist in a time where there was such divide in the world, a world filled with war, violence, and poverty. Rachel sought out a number of charities, where she learned that for a small payment she could contribute to efforts tackling the issues she cared about in the world. Rachel felt less gloomy, as she read the inspirational stories of the charities, and her outlook on the world was brighter.
